Module schiffeversenken
Package de.uniluebeck.itm.schiffeversenken.engine.uicomponents

Class Textbox

java.lang.Object
de.uniluebeck.itm.schiffeversenken.engine.uicomponents.Component
de.uniluebeck.itm.schiffeversenken.engine.uicomponents.Textbox
All Implemented Interfaces:
Drawable, TextInput
Direct Known Subclasses:
MaskedTextBox
public class Textbox extends Component implements Drawable, TextInput
This class represents a text box. This is a component where the user can input text.
Author:
leondietrich

  • Constructor Details

    • Textbox

      public Textbox(String defaultText, int x, int y, int width, int height)
      Use this constructor in order to generate a new text box.
      Parameters:
      defaultText - The text to begin with (can be empty or null)
      x - The x coordinate where the component should be placed.
      y - The y coordinate where the component should be placed.
      width - The width of the component.
      height - The height of the component.

  • Method Details

    • setText

      public void setText(String text)
      This setter sets the new text and puts the cursor position at its end.
      Parameters:
      text - The new text to set

    • getText

      public String getText()
      Use this method in order to get the content of the text buffer.
      Returns:
      The current text

    • getOwnActiveState

      public boolean getOwnActiveState()
      Description copied from interface: TextInput
      This method should represent the components own activation state. It will be used by a ComponentView
      Specified by:
      getOwnActiveState in interface TextInput
      Returns:
      The internal state.

    • registerKeyInput

      public void registerKeyInput(int key, boolean down, boolean up, boolean left, boolean right)
      Description copied from interface: TextInput
      This method gets called by a ComponentController when there is new Text to be stored.
      Specified by:
      registerKeyInput in interface TextInput
      Parameters:
      key - The key that was pressed.
      down - Was the down arrow key pressed?
      up - Was the up arrow key pressed?
      left - Was the left arrow key pressed?
      right - Was the right arrow key pressed?

    • getCurrentTextBuffer

      public String getCurrentTextBuffer()
      Description copied from interface: TextInput
      As most text inputs consist of an internal buffer this method should contain its state. A calling method must assume that it may return null if it isn't appropriate.
      Specified by:
      getCurrentTextBuffer in interface TextInput
      Returns:
      The current buffer content as a String or null.
